reg:regulation.reg:title:
Regional Health Authorities
Retention of Fees Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 238/2012, July 31, 2012]

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this regulation, Regional Health Authority means a Regional Health Board designated under the Health Authorities Act.

A Regional Health Authority may, as provided in an agreement between the Minister of Health Services and the Regional Health Authority respecting the criteria for the collection of fees as set out in section 3 of this regulation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: retain as a commission 100% of the fees collected under section 3 of B.C. Reg. 274/92, the Health Act Fees Regulation, and not remitted under that section,
retain 100% of the fees collected under section 6 (2) (b) of B.C. Reg. 296/2010, the Pool Regulation,
retain 100% of the fees collected under section 7 (1) (b) of B.C. Reg. 200/2003, the Drinking Water Protection Regulation, and
retain 100% of the fees collected under section 4 (2) of B.C. Reg. 326/2004, the Sewerage System Regulation.

bcl:section.bcl:text: An agreement under section 2 must specify that the collector must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: collect the fees referred to in section 2,
maintain complete, legible records of all fees referred to in section 2 and collected, and
hold all records referred to in paragraph (b) open for audit or inspection as may be required by the Minister of Finance.

reg:content.reg:regnote: Note: this regulation replaces B.C. Reg. 34/98.
reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Financial Administration Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 138, section 14 (2)]
